description: An 85-year-old man was shot and killed by a police officer after calling the police to his home Saturday, telling them he wanted to ''go to the cemetery'' and then turning toward them with a loaded .38 caliber revolver, the authorities said. The man was shot once in the head and died about two hours later at a local hospital, the police said. His name was withheld pending notification of relatives. The police said the man had a history of mental problems and had indicated in the past to police that he wanted to commit suicide. The San Bernardino Sheriff's Department is investigating the shooting.

title: AMERICAN LEAGUE;JAYS WIN ON 2 HOMERS IN 10TH
description: Al Oliver and Garth Iorg hit 10th-inning home runs today, leading the Toronto Blue Jays to 5-3 victory over the the Kansas City Royals.

title: TV REVIEW;TRAIN SERIES RECALLS JOURNEY TO BUDAPEST
description: MOST of the romance died long ago, of course, but some will always remain. Railroads have something about them. ''Great Railway Journeys of the World,'' a public-television series, proves that adventure is not dead. Tonight's episode, ''Changing Trains,'' on Channel 13 at 10, takes us on a classic route: London to Budapest.

title: THE REGION;Jersey Data Claim Statue of Liberty
description: A state historian says he has discovered a document that proves that the Statue of Liberty is actually in New Jersey and not New York.

title: ARMY SEEKING 'SMOKESCREEN' TO HIDE FORCES FROM ENEMY
description: Army researchers here are pursuing what they call the universal obscurant, an airborne material that would obscure a target from an attacking enemy.

title: THE QUEEN IS AN ACE
description: ROSIE BLACK'S best pitches? ''Well,'' she says, with only a slight hesitation, ''the riser, the drop, the sinking curve and the flat curve, the knuckleball, three or four changeups and I guess you'd have to include the in-drop, too.''

title: ISRAELI PANEL COOL TO DEPORTATION
description: An Israeli military advisory board today urged reconsideration of a decision to banish a Palestinian activist from the occupied West Bank.

title: PUBLISHING AUCTION OF 'LOVER' FOR PAPERBACK
description: MARGUERITE DURAS'S novel ''The Lover'' has been on The New York Times fiction best-seller list for one month now, and tomorrow it is being auctioned for paperback. But its success does not exactly bathe the book industry in glory, since a large part of that industry greeted its publication here lukewarmly - even though it sold some 800,000 copies in France, was that country's No. 1 best seller for more than six months and won the 1984 Prix Goncourt, France's most prestigious literary prize.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: Does Ty Cobb hold the record for stealing home the most times in a career? Who has the National League mark? What's the record for one season?

title: 2 INDEPENDENT PRODUCERS TURN TO OTHER ROLES
description: The coming Broadway season will find one veteran producer, Harold Prince, on the sidelines, and another, Nelle Nugent, branching into television and film projects. Taken together, the decisions reflect some of the recent difficulties for Broadway's independent producers.

title: Leslie Scharoff Bride Of Dr. Sanford Dubner
description: At Temple Israel of Lawrence, L.I., yesterday Leslie Jill Scharoff, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Donald R. Scharoff of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married to Dr. Sanford Dubner, a son of Anita Dubner and the late Sidney Dubner of Howard Beach, Queens. Rabbi Jack Stern Jr., assisted by Rabbi Raphael Saffra and Cantor Bernard Beer, performed the ceremony.

title: 3 IN HARTFORD IMPORTING RECORDS OF RUSSIAN JAZZ
description: Pressed in vinyl, wrapped in a record sleeve inside an album jacket, the Russians are coming.

title: AROUND THE NATION;Suspect in Shooting of 4 In Arkansas Is Caught
description: Police officers seeking a gunman who wounded two officers today and killed two other men surrounded a house and fired tear gas, then heard a shot from inside and found a suspect with a head wound, the authorities said.

title: Suave Shoe Lays Off 400
description: The Suave Shoe Corporation, the largest shoe manufacturer in Florida, has laid off 400 of its 1,400 workers because of competition from low-cost imports, company officials said. ''We have no immediate plans to recall any of them,'' Pedro Mirones, secretary and assistant general manager, said Friday. Some of the laid-off workers have been employed by Suave for 20 years.

title: ADVERTISING;Benton & Bowles Loses Tropicana Account
description: Beatrice U. S. Food said it would reassign its Tropicana juice account.

title: METS BEAT CUBS, 6-2, FOR SWEEP
description: It was last August at precisely this time that the Mets were taking the big tumble, blowing nine games in the standing in 15 disastrous days that included seven defeats in seven games against the Chicago Cubs. But the memory lingers no more.

title: O'BRIEN IMPRESSIVE IN DEFEAT
description: Joe Walton has staked much of his coaching future with the Jets on Ken O'Brien, and today Walton sounded impressed with his pet project.

title: SPORTS WORLD SPECIALS;Catching Up
description: Juan Bonilla is the infielder who took treatment for drug addiction in 1982, was released by the San Diego Padres in spring training the following year, sat out 1984, and was signed this year to a minor league contract by the Yankees. Now he may be back on the road to the majors, with one team or another. Bonilla is hitting about .320 at Columbus, where he is playing regularly at second base, third base and shortstop, and Woody Woodward, the Yankees' vice president for baseball administration, says: ''We get nothing but good reports on him. He's being a good citizen and hustling all the time. He's attracting a lot of attention from other clubs.'' Bonilla understands that he is at a crossroads. ''This can be a turning point in my life,'' he says. ''I want to get back to the major leagues. The drugs were a very bad experience in my life, but I am keeping that all behind me.''

title: BRIEFING;Herein a Mention
description: Critics of contemporary political reporting are forever asking how various candidates come to be identified in articles as having been ''mentioned'' for a certain office. One possible answer arrived on the desk of a Washington editor the other day from a New Orleans attorney. His air-mailed note read, in entirety: ''I have been recommended by the experts as 'The Best Qualified Candidate for the Presidency of the United States, Democratic Party, 1988. Your advise, encouragement and support will be appreciated. Wishing you good health, success and happiness.'' His name is being withheld to avoid irresponsible mentioning.

title: America's Economic House of Cards
description: America's economy has become a house of cards, and the most wobbly part is not interest rates or the budget or trade - it is the United States dollar. A major drop in the value of the dollar is not inconceivable. And Washington is poorly prepared for it.

title: Complex Reopens Following Slayings
description: A sports and recreation complex where 2 people were fatally shot and more than 20 were injured during a shootout between patrons on Aug. 11 reopened this weekend.

title: CABLE'S 'MUST-CARRY' RULES BENEFITED NO ONE
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;James Beard's Legacy
description: The graceful four-story town house that was owned by James Beard will go on the market this week, and the contents will be sold at auction in October, according to an executor of the estate.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE;Head of Paramount Unit Going to New Venture
description: The Paramount Pictures Corporation, a subsidiary of Gulf and Western Industries, announced that Randy Reiss, president of its domestic television and video programming unit, would leave the company later this year to head a new communications-entertainment investment enterprise.

title: Remember the Oil Noose?
description: Times are tough in the oil business. A barrel that brought nearly $40 five years ago now sells for less than $28. Oil rigs sit idle in Texas graveyards. Scores of smaller companies hover on the brink as black gold has yielded to black humor. ''A fella was tellin' me the other day that things were picking up in the oil patch,'' one oil man told The Wall Street Journal. ''They picked up his car this week, and they'll be back to pick up his house.''

title: THE DANCE: PAM QUINN AND MICHAEL O'CONNOR
description: TEXT IS SEXY,'' a sign reads on the bulletin board of Dance Theater Workshop, and indeed words have become desirable as material for post-modernist dance. But words and movement were puzzling fellow travelers in a program of three new and recent collaborative pieces by Pam Quinn and Michael O'Connor, presented by the Workshop on Saturday at its Bessie Schonberg Theater.

title: TWO STARS PEAKING FOR DUEL IN TRAVERS
description: Between them, Woody Stephens and Angel Cordero Jr. have won the Kentucky Derby four times, the Preakness three times and the Belmont Stakes five times, more victories in Triple Crown races than any of their contemporaries. Yet neither has won the Travers Stakes.

title: VIOLENCE ERUPTS AT BLACK'S RITES IN A 'HOMELAND'
description: A black crowd ran down a black soldier near this village today and stoned and burned him to death. But the killing seemed to add little more than a statistic to the chronicles of 11 months of unrest that has claimed almost 600 lives.

title: Home on the Range, Urban-Style
description: If Frederick Jackson Turner, the famed historian of the fading American frontier, were dropped today into New York's Lower East Side, Washington's Capitol Hill or Baltimore's Fells Point, he would hardly recognize the physical landscape, but he would understand the language all too well.

title: AROUND THE WORLD;Mozambican Rebels Accused of Killing 33
description: The official Mozambique radio said today that guerrillas killed 33 villagers attending a funeral near this southeast African country's border with Malawi.

title: GREEN WINNER OF PGA
description: Hubert Green withstood the pressures of a thrilling head-to-head match against Lee Trevino today and the distractions of his own temper to win the 67th PGA Championship by two shots over Trevino, the udefending champion.

title: ROBBERY AND GENEROSITY COLOR MEXICAN VACATION
description: It began as an ordinary vacation in Mexico, with sun-drenched days in Cuernavaca and Acapulco, treks to settings of picturesque antiquity in Mexico City and soft nights in Taxco under the shimmering stars.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Thursday about L. F. Rothschild, Unterberg, Towbin gave an incorrect description, obtained from the firm, of the leadership of its arbitrage department. The department is headed by John M. Angelo and Donald J. Friedman.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: 1945: THE WORLD WE FOUGHT FOR. By Robert Kee. 371 pages. Illustrated. Little, Brown. $19.95.

title: Dr. Robert Fields Wed To Barbara D. Bender
description: At the Jewish Community Center in Harrison, N.Y., yesterday Barbara Diane Bender, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Bender of Valley Stream, L.I., was married to Dr. Robert H. Fields, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nat Fields of Scarsdale, N.Y. Rabbi Norton Shargel performed the ceremony.

title: OUTDOORS: IF ANGLING FAILS, SHELLFISHING IS AN ALTERNATIVE
description: WHEN I am frustrated in my attempts to gather provender by angling, I turn, knowing that success is inevitable, to shellfishing.

title: FUTURES/OPTIONS;Gold Trading Turns Lively
description: AFTER meandering aimlessly for months, the gold futures market suddenly awoke with a start last Friday, causing the once somnolent bears to hastily rush to buy contracts to cover the bullion they had sold short. As prices rose, brokers reported a flurry of fresh buying by bullish investors.

title: Bridge: Quarterfinal Round Begins At Spingold Team Tourney
description: The quarterfinal stage of the Spingold Knockout Team Championship began here this afternoon with the defending champions on the sidelines.

title: SPORTS WORLD SPECIALS;The Right Track
description: For someone who is serving a 15-year Federal sentence for conspiracy to distribute cocaine and marijuana, Larry Burt is an optimistic sort. This may be because of his involvement in a prison rehabilitation program stressing ''positive addiction,'' specifically, addiction to long-distance running.

title: POPE, IN CAMEROON, ASSAILS SOUTH AFRICAN INJUSTICS
description: Pope John Paul II today attributed the widening ''bloody confrontations'' in South Africa to ''the unjust situation that is exasperating the various communities'' in the racially divided country.

title: Economic Calendar
description: Listed below are the target release dates for major economic indicators scheduled to be released this week.

title: GONZALES WINS DEBUT
description: Paul Gonzales, the 1984 Olympic flyweight champion, scored a unanimous decision over Jose Torres today in his professional debut.

title: Petition to an 'Affable' Soviet Foreign Minister
description: To the Editor:

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE;Columbia Gas Chief Seeks Cut in Costs
description: As a young engineer fresh out of North Carolina State University, John H. Croom said, he was attracted to The Columbia Gas System Inc. because of the natural gas industry's bright prospects for growth.

title: MUSIC: MOSTLY MOZART PRESENTS 'ALEXANDER-FEST'
description: HANDEL played a peculiar role last Friday night, leaving his own era -which he represents and explains so brilliantly - and telling us about later one.

title: STUDY PREDICTS SUSTAINED GROWTH FOR NEW YORK REGION'S ECONOMY
description: The economy of New York City and its suburbs, buoyed by a swift, five-year recovery, has entered a period of sustained growth that will be halted only if the region fails to provide enough new housing, according to an economic analysis released yesterday.

title: Focus May Shift to Economy
description: After absorbing $21.75 billion of new Treasury notes and bonds last week, the focus of attention in the credit markets could revert this week to a barrage of fresh economic statistics, from which traders and investors hope to discern the future direction of interest rates.

title: Protect, and Perfect, Tax Reform
description: The House Ways and Means Committee took testimony on President Reagan's tax plan from some 450 witnesses. Approximately 449 found something wrong with it, and not even its chief backer, the Secretary of the Treasury, called it perfect. It surely isn't, but the question now is whether the concept is still alive. All taxpayers should hope so.

title: The Love of Penguins
description: To the Editor:

title: CITY OPERA: 'I PURITANI'
description: IF it took a revival of Bellini's ''Puritani'' to lure Faye Robinson back to the New York City Opera after an absence of six years, then the revival at the State Theater last night was worth it on that count alone. Miss Robinson qualifies as one of America's finer contributions to the international operatic stage; her soprano voice is a beautiful instrument that she deploys with considerable skill, she moves freely on the stage and she has star quality.

title: MARKETING OF BIOTECHNOLOGY
description: The biotechnology industry, after years of promises, is finally starting to bring products to market. But for the companies in the industry, the seemingly joyous milestone might only be the start of new problems.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Following is a partial list of dividend meetings for the week of Aug. 12, 1985:

title: THE REGION;Pollution Tests Set At Military Bases
description: The State Environmental Protection Department will begin this week to collect soil and water samples near all nine military bases in New Jersey to determine if there are pollution problems. If the tests indicate pollution, the department will carry out its own cleanup plans around the bases.

title: JETS' STRATEGISTS: MEN IN MOTION
description: THE Jets may not actually be smarter this year, but at least they are trying to be - from management, to the coaches, to the players. And that is a start. But will it be enough?

title: Jane Goldenberg Marries Daniel Mintz
description: Jane R. Goldenberg, the daughter of Charles L. Goldenberg of New York and Audrey T. Shulman of Warren, N.J., and Boca Raton, Fla., was married yesterday to Daniel H. Mintz, the son of Dr. and Mrs. David T. Mintz of Scarsdale, N.Y. Rabbi James Perman performed the ceremony at La Petite Ferme, a restaurant in Manhattan.

title: 530 Million in Corporate Issues Due
description: While securities dealers continue to distribute the Treasury notes and bonds that were auctioned last week, they are looking forward to this week, when no Treasury financings are scheduled, except for the regular weekly sale of new bills.

title: ADVERTISING;Dancer Fitzgerald Has Equity in China/USA
description: Dancer Fitzgerald Sample said it has taken an equity position, for an undisclosed amount, in China/USA Communications Inc., the American partner in a venture with China Central Television, China's state-owned and sole television network. The venture will provide production, programming and consulting services. It is the only company with an exclusive license to sell prime commercial time on Chinese television.

title: LOBBYISTS GET TIPS ON GETTING THEIR WAY
description: Yes, Arthur N. Malkin knows that ''lobbyist'' is considered a dirty word in some circles of state government. And yes, he has heard the argument that one thing wrong with government is that there are too many lobbyists.

title: Honduras May Cut Power to Nicaragua
description: The Honduran Government has warned Nicaragua that it will cut electricity exports to Nicaragua within a week if the Sandinista Government does not pay $500,000 in overdue bills.

title: Deborah A. Kaple Wed at Princeton
description: Deborah Ann Kaple, the daughter of Esther L. Kaple of Lima, Ohio, and John D. Kaple of Ottawa, Ohio, was married in Princeton, N.J., yesterday to Jeffrey Hirsh Blattner, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter M. Blattner of Pittsburgh. Rabbi Eric Wisnia performed the ceremony at Prospect House on the Princeton University campus.

title: BRIEFING;Of Justice
description: The Federal courts are getting tired of wasting their time on frivolous cases. For the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia, the last 16 appeals by Casimer Urban Jr. were the final blow. In all these cases, a three-judge panel observed in an opinion, ''The court is unable to hazard even the most elementary guess as to the relief Mr. Urban seeks, at a loss to decipher the nature of the claims pursued and unable to discern a plausible nexus between the complaint and the named defendants.'' His list includes the United Nations, U.S.A. Judicial Branch, U.S. Congress, U.S.A. and so on.

title: 1.15 BILLION MIDCON BID FOR UNITED
description: The Midcon Corporation will acquire United Energy Resources Inc. for $41 a share, or a total of $1.15 billion, in a deal that would create one of the largest natural gas pipeline concerns in the nation, the companies announced last night.

title: YELLOW RAIN': NEW SUPPORT FOR HONEYBEE THEORY
description: Five scientists, in their most comprehensive report published, asserted again today that what is called yellow rain is actually ''the feces of honeybees'' and not from a chemical weapon from the Soviet Union, as the United States Government has described it.

title: TRIAL STARTS TODAY FOR TULANE'S STAR
description: The former Tulane basketball star, John (Hot Rod) Williams, will go to trial Monday in the first of four anticipated trials stemming from allegations of point-shaving at two home games last season.

title: RATS APLENTY, BUT NOT AS MANY
description: First it was cockroaches in the Capitol. Then it was mice in the White House and raccoons in Georgetown. And today, despite the multitude of fat cats who prowl the streets of Washington, it's rats.

title: MUSIC: PHILADELPHIANS PLAY WAGNER AND GLASS
description: The prime matter of music is time, and no two composers use it so differently as Richard Wagner and Philip Glass. On the green and spacious grounds of the Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saturday night, Dennis Russell Davies conducted the Philadelphia Orchestra, the Saratoga-Potsdam Chorus and seven vocal soloists in operatic music of both men - the final act of Wagner's ''Tristan und Isolde'' and the second from Mr. Glass's ''Akhnaten.'' Both works tested the listener severely in their use of time's passage, and this was an evening which alternately strained, fascinated, galled, bored and sublimely enriched.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;Consonant Trouble
description: A Brooklyn man pulled his car into a gas station last weekend at Flatbush Avenue Extension and Tillary Street. The woman in the car ahead was pleading for assistance in an exotic accent; her license plates identified her as a Marylander.

title: 10 1/2 High-Jump Mark Set
description: Rudolf Povarnitsyn of the Soviet Union set a world record in the high jump today, leaping 7 feet 10 1/2 inches, according to the official news agency Tass.

title: N.S. Poser, Law Professor, Married to Judith E. Cohn
description: Judith E. Cohn, the publicity director of Macy's New York and manager of beauty and fashion special events for its Herald Square store, was married yesterday to Norman S. Poser, a professor at the Brooklyn Law School and former executive vice president of the American Stock Exchange. Rabbi Bernard Cohn performed the ceremony at the Lotos Club in New York.

title: NO STORM WARNING FOR DOOMED JET
description: Air traffic controllers did not tell the crew of a Delta Airlines jet that crashed in Texas about a weather forecast indicating the possibility of thunderstorms, Federal officials said today. The forecast was issued 10 minutes before the crash on Aug. 2.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: MONDAY, AUGUST 12, 1985
description: Companies

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: AAV Companies, a Cleveland-based concern that provides vending and food services, has named Thomas J. Nero president.

title: The Editorial Notebook;A Home - and a Shoulder
description: Programs for battered women are springing up in many places around the country, but one in New York City has something different: private dwellings offered as temporary ''safe'' homes for women who have left abusive husbands or boyfriends. Sanctuaries for Families, a public and privately funded program of the city's Human Resources Administration, serves working women who don't qualify for city-run shelters reserved for welfare recipients. But the program has more applicants than spaces, and H.R.A. wants to make it possible for more people to experience its special rewards.

title: ADVERTISING;Students' Real-Life Challenges
description: JAN H. REMAK and Naranaswamy Sivakumar, graduate students at Rice University in Houston, undertook a challenge in advertising and marketing. Suppose they worked for Philip Morris Inc., the producer of Marlboro cigarettes, 7-Up soft drinks and Miller beers. Could they create a new product that would fit into the company's existing businesses and add sales, but not cannibalize the market share of any of the existing products?

title: Congress Campaign Gifts Up
description: Members of the House and Senate tax-writing committees raised $10.4 million in campaign contributions in the first six months of 1985, Common Cause, the public affairs lobby, has reported.

title: SPORTS WORLD SPECIALS;A Certain Age
description: When 46-year-old Phil Niekro almost pitched a shutout not long ago, it was pointed out that he would have been the oldest player to have ever done so in the majors. But he was a mere youngster compared with some others who set age records. Satchel Paige was 59, probably, when he hurled three shutout innings for Kansas City in 1965, thereby becoming the oldest pitcher to make a major league appearance of any duration. Some help from Lloyd Johnson, the senior researcher at the Baseball Hall of Fame, brings to light these other members of an all-oldies team:

title: 2 ROOKIE RUNNERS LIFT GIANTS' HOPES
description: It was almost too good to be true. The Giants' 21-20 preseason victory over the Houston Oilers a week ago had been expected because the Oilers were a 3-13 team last year. But the Denver Broncos, the Giants' opponents here Saturday night, were 13-3 last year, and their defense was celebrated.

title: POP: MAZE AT THE BEACON
description: MAZE, the Philadelphia-based septet headed by the singer and composer Frankie Beverly, offers an interesting hybrid of late 60's soul and 80's pop-funk styles. The band, which appeared at the Beacon Theater (Broadway and 74th Street) on Saturday, has earned seven consecutive gold albums. And while the group lacks the sophistication and breadth of Kool & the Gang and Earth, Wind & Fire, it succeeds much of the time in avoiding pop-funk cliches.

title: MONDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. Philadelphia Phillies, at Shea Stadium, 7:35 P.M. Opener of a four-game series. (Television -SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WHN, 1050; 7:30 P.M.) Yankees vs. White Sox, at Chicago. Opener of a three-game series on a brief road trip for the Yankees. (Television - Channel 11, 8:30 P.M. Radio - WABC, 770; 8:30 P.M.) Tennis United Jersey Bank Classic, at Ramapo College, Mahwah, N.J. Opening round of play, 10 A.M. and 7 P.M. Martina Navratilova, who won last year before going on to win the United States Open, will not compete this year. Her doubles partner, Pam Shriver, is seeded No. 1 and will open play tonight. Zina Garrison is No. 2, Manuela Maleeva of Bulgaria No. 3 and Helena Sukova of Czechoslovakia fourth. Canadian Open, at Montreal, opening round. Jimmy Connors, Ivan Lendl and John McEnroe are all expected to play after competing in Vermont last week. (Television - SportsChannel, 11:30 P.M., tape.) United States National Amateur Championships, at Concord Hotel, Kiamesha Lake, N.Y. Opening round, 9 A.M. The field of 64 men and 32 women begin play in this tournament to determine the best American amateurs. The women's singles and doubles finals will be held Friday; the men's singles and doubles finals Saturday. Other Events BICYCLING: Coors International Classic, California to Colorado. HARNESS RACING: Yonkers, 8 P.M. The Meadowlands, 8 P.M. (Television - MSG Network, midnight) THOROUGHBRED RACING: Saratoga, 1:30 P.M. The $75,000-added Diana Handicap for fillies and mares 3 years old and up at a mile and an eighth is the feature. (Television - SportsChannel, 6:30 and 11 P.M.). Monmouth Park, 1:30 P.M. Atlantic City, 8 P.M.

title: Delta Jet Pilot Voiced Little Fear of a Crash
description: The pilot of Delta Air Lines Flight 191 voiced little concern about a thunderstorm just before the jumbo jet crashed, killing 134 people, according to a transcript of conversations between air traffic controllers and the crew that were made public today by the Federal Aviation Administration.

title: The Past Is the Future
description: For all the passionate talk, there is a soothing calm and serenity in this part of Greece.

title: INFRARED INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: b-Net income c-Including an extraordinary credit of $138,000.

title: CHINESE COURT FINDS U.S. CITIZEN GUILTY IN FATAL HOTEL FIRE
description: An American businessman accused of starting a fatal fire in the Swan Hotel in Harbin was found guilty of criminal negligence today and sentenced to 18 months in jail, a court official said.

title: America's 'Night Out' To Shed Light on Crime
description: The second ''National Night Out'' will be held tonight to rally support for neighborhood crime watch programs.

title: Oilers' 2 Top Picks Remain Unsigned
description: The number of National Football League first-round draft choices still unsigned is down to four, but two of them belong to the Houston Oilers, who can ill afford their absence.

title: AMERICAN FIBER OPTICS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Better Baseball Bats
description: The search for a better baseball bat has turned to plastics. As a result, baseball fans may someday hear the crack of the ball against a graphite-reinforced shell of polycarbonate polybutylene terephthalate resin filled with cellular urethane foam.

title: Name-Calling
description: New Hampshire lobs alliterative insults. Governor Cuomo challenges. New Hampshire accepts. And the verbal Ping-Pong match continues.

title: MAY PETROLEUM INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
T.W.A. SAID TO MEET ON BIDS TODAY
description: The board of directors of Trans World Airlines, after a prolonged takeover struggle, will hold what is expected to be a decisive meeting today on the future of the airline, sources involved in the negotiations said yesterday.

title: WITNESS TESTIFIES EX-AGENT CRIED AFTER SUSPENSION OVER HIS WEIGHT
description: The first agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation to be charged with espionage ''began sobbing'' in the squad room when he learned that he was suspended for two weeks without pay for being overweight, according to testimony today in his Federal trial on the spying charges.

title: Youth Gets 9 Years For Slaying Friend
description: A 16-year-old fascinated by guns and war games was sentenced today to nine years to life in prison for shooting a 13-year-old friend to death.

title: YACHT WRECKAGE EXAMINED
description: The wreckage of Drum, the British pop star Simon Le Bon's yacht, was towed today to deep water off Mevagissey, a Cornwall port, and questions remained as to what caused it to capsize Sunday in gale-force winds.

title: U.S., Japan Set Chip Talks
description: The United States trade representative, Clayton K. Yeutter, and Japanese officials agreed today to hold talks on semiconductors, one of a number of issues contributing to trade friction between the two nations, Japanese officials said.

title: Farberware Switch
description: Farberware, the New York household appliance and cookware division of Kidde Inc., has ended its more than 20-year association with Smith/ Greenland Inc. and named DBK&O Inc. in Minneapolis as its agency. ''We have new management and we wanted new directions,'' said Paul Taccini, vice president marketing at Farberware. According to Mr. Taccini, the account is worth between $1 million and $1.5 million.

title: 250 FLEE TOXIC CLOUD AS TRAIN DERAILS IN ARIZONA
description: A freight train carrying hazardous materials derailed and burned today, spewing clouds of toxic smoke and forcing the evacuation of the 250 residents of three towns. No injuries were reported.

title: Advertising;   Wildman Importers
description: Frederick Wildman Importers, a wine-importing subsidiary of Hiram Walker Inc., has appointed Homer & Durham Advertising to handle its account, as well as strategic and new product development. Next year's budget is projected at $1 million. Wildman's major brands include Moreau and Callaway.

title: A.T.&T. Center
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said that it plans to establish a credit and collections center in Charleston, W. Va., to handle $1 billion to $3 billion worth of accounts. Officials said the center will create 400 jobs and is expected to open by the end of 1987. John Landers, vice president of A.T.& T. West Virginia, said Charleston was selected because it is the site of a major switching center.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: COPS. Their Lives in Their Own Words.

title: TELECONCEPTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
SEABOARD CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 1
NEW JEWISH PHILANTHROPY AIMING AT NONSECTARIAN AID FOR ALL POOR
description: A new foundation, seeking to make a mark as a Jewish philanthropy that aids all poor people, is helping Navajos in Arizona, homeless blacks in Boston and low-income Mexican-Americans in Colorado.

title: Market Place;   The Riddle Of Pan Am
description: VAGUE, yet persistent, takeover rumors have made a star out of the downtrodden Pan Am Corporation in recent weeks, but the consensus among Wall Street analysts is that the airline's business situation is far from sparkling. In fact, the analysts generally agree that if someone does not try to take over the company pretty soon, Pan Am's stock may stop twinkling.

title: GENERAL NUTRITION CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 20
description: b-After a charge of $3,500,000 for the settlement of an antitrust suit filed by a competing retailer.

title: PIEDMONT MANAGEMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
HORN & HARDART CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 29
UNITIL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
TRUMP AND HARRAH'S FEUD OVER NAME
description: Donald Trump owns a casino here. Harrah's owns a casino here. And together they are 50-50 partners in a third casino.

title: BUFFTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
INQUIRY SOUGHT ON OFFICIAL'S LETTER ON RELIGION
description: The Treasury Department was asked today to investigate how one of its employees came to write a letter denouncing a California lawyer who had questioned the Government's distribution of a speech asserting that the United States is a Christian nation.

title: HARPER GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in June.

title: NEWPORT ELECTRIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
The World According to C-Span
description: C-Span, the cable television network, has somehow thrived by carrying the long, unedited proceedings of the House of Representatives, other Government forums and call-in shows on weighty public issues.

title: Dolphin Returns
description: Nat Moore, the Miami Dolphins' wide receiver, who had announced last year that it would have be his final season, returned to the Dolphins for the coming season. Moore signed a contract, whose terms were not disclosed.

title: SNAPPIER RESORT DESIGNS
description: Fashion's newest directions are being plotted in Seventh Avenue design rooms where resort collections are taking shape. These are the warm-weather clothes to be worn in the South as well as at resort areas next winter. They are the forerunners of fashions to be developed for next spring and summer and provide a good indication of what designers are thinking.

title: TENNEY ENGINEERING INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Consumer Credit Report
description: The Federal Reserve Board said that the consumer installment credit report for June, scheduled for Tuesday, was now tentatively scheduled to be released on Wednesday.

title: Storm Heading Out to Sea
description: Tropical Storm Claudette passed Bermuda and headed for the open sea today, but hurricane watchers warned that another storm developing in the Caribbean posed a threat to western Cuba and the Yucatan Peninsula. Claudette's maximum sustained winds were clocked by an Air Force reconnaissance plane at about 50 miles per hour.

title: CARBIDE BLAMES A FAULTY DESIGN FOR TOXIC LEAK
description: The Union Carbide Corporation said today that operating and design problems in a new chemical process had caused a toxic gas leak that injured at least 135 people here Sunday.

title: WRIGHT, WILLIAM E CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Protesters Clash With Police in Pakistan
description: Hundreds of heavily armed police officers dispersed demonstrators with riot sticks and tear gas today after thousands of people protested the killing of nine members of a single family.

title: Fairer Terms for Divorced Women
description: After 35 years of marriage, the Long Island woman was telling a committee of New York's Legislature, her husband ''strayed from marriage courting another woman,'' and drained their savings account, their only jointly held asset. Fearing for the future, she said she ''took heart in the newly enacted New York State Equitable Distribution Law,'' and filed for divorce in 1982. Now it turns out that the law is not all that she, and thousands of other women, had hoped.

title: VISION THROUGH ANIMAL EYES REVEALS SURPRISING COLOR
description: THE world of animal vision, long a gray area for scientists, is beginning to come alive with color.

title: 16 DEAD AND 75 INJURED IN BEIRUT AS MILITIAS CONTINUE TO DO BATTLE
description: Militiamen battled across Beirut's dividing line today, and gunners on both sides hit residential areas with artillery fire. At least 16 people were reported killed and 75 wounded.

title: Religion Was the Colonial School Curriculum
description: To the Editor:

title: STRONG PLAN ON AIR SAFETY REPORTED
description: The Federal Aviation Administration is planning a 46 percent increase over the next two years in the number of personnel assigned to aircraft safety inspection, Congressional and Department of Transportation sources said today.

title: RIBI IMMUNOCHEM RESEARCH reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Advertising;   Addenda
description: * Marketshare/Doremus, the marketing public relations division of Doremus & Co., announced that it will merge Eileen Prescott Co. into its operations on Aug. 15.

title: CPT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income.

title: UNIVERSITY GRAPHICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ALTERNATE ROUTE LEADS TEACHERS TO THE CLASSROOM
description: KATHLEEN KASAY grew up wanting to become a schoolteacher, but the job outlook in education was so dismal when she was graduated from St. Joseph's Hill Academy on Staten Island in 1976 that she abandoned her goal even before she entered college. Instead, she majored in biology at Lafayette College in Pennsylvania and went into industrial research.

title: REBELS IN UGANDA SIGHTED NEAR A KEY TOWN
description: Uganda's largest rebel group was reported today to be marching toward the country's third-largest town.

title: Cigarette Companies And the Manville Suits
description: To the Editor:

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''We're going to go over this plant with a fine-tooth comb, to find if other systems have problems.'' - Carl G. Beard, director of the West Virginia Air Pollution Control Commission. [B8:4.]

title: Portuguese Governor Who Yielded Goa Dies
description: Gen. Manuel Antonio Vassalo e Silva, the colonial Governor who defied his Government and surrendered Portuguese India in 1961, died Sunday after a long illness, his family said. He was 86 years old.

title: CARE ENTERPRISES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Advertising;   Swatch's Total Look Campaign
description: AROUND the Fifth Avenue headquarters of Swatch U.S.A. the word Swatch, a combination of Swiss and watch, is used as an adjective, a noun and a verb. ''We say Swatch yourself,'' said Nancy Kadner, director of advertising for the Swiss-based company. That means wearing one, two or three plastic Swatch watches at a time. And, it will soon mean wearing items from an expanding line of Swatch accessories.

title: Colombia Rebels Attack A Police Outpost
description: Rebels firing rocket-propelled grenades and assault rifles attacked a mountaintop police and army outpost overlooking this capital city of 6 million people today, the Defense Ministry said.

title:
BEYOND GRADUAL CHANGE IN SOUTH AFRICA;

Make It The 51st State
description: Remarkably enough, there is a solution for South Africa's problems. It is a solution that only the United States can broker: namely, to offer South Africa a place as the 51st state of the union.

title: XL-DATACOMP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
NORTHVIEW CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income.

title: NORRIS OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Allied-Signal Tie Proves Lucrative to Executives
description: When the Allied Corporation and the Signal Companies announced their $5 billion merger in May, top excutives of both companies spoke of the benefits the deal would bring to their shareholders. Now shareholders have been informed that the executives will reap substantial rewards of their own.

title: MAINE PUBLIC SERVICE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a charge of $806,586 for the quarter and 6 months to reflect the utility's investment in Seabrook 2 nuclear unit.

title: DOW FALLS 6.50 AFTER PROFIT TAKING
description: Stock prices ended broadly lower yesterday after a late rally failed to push equities into plus territory.

title: CANADIAN PACIFIC LTD reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
DOLLAR DIPS SHARPLY FOR 2D DAY
description: The dollar sank yesterday, in its second sharp drop in two trading days because of fears that economic growth in the United States will be weaker than expected.

title: Peaceful Struggle Is Futile
description: The agenda for change in South Africa is no longer being decided in the White House, 10 Downing Street, Elysee Palace or the Union Building in Pretoria. It is being decided in the townships of South Africa and among the voters of the Western countries.

title: NEW-CAR DEALERS LOSE SALES IN HAULERS' STRIKE
description: With the strike by 21,000 automobile haulers now in its third week, new-car dealers around the nation say they are losing sales because they cannot get the cars they promised their customers.

title: Ohio Water Issue Of $262.5 Million
description: The Ohio Water Development Authority is offering a $262.5 million issue of safe water refunding and improvement bonds that were tentatively priced yesterday with a maximum yield of 9.32 percent for bonds due in 2012 through underwriters led by McDonald & Company Securities, Cleveland.

title: SCIENCE DYNAMICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Long Shot Wins Diana
description: Jeffrey Fell, who has been riding in Canada the last two years, returned to Saratoga Race Track today and engineered an upset victory aboard Lake Country in the $97,050 Diana Handicap.

title: 10 Rebels Slain in Peru
description: At least 10 Maoist rebels were killed in a clash with soldiers in a Peruvian jungle district as security forces stepped up a counterinsurgency offensive, military sources said today. They said the rebels were killed Friday when soldiers overran a rebel camp 180 miles north of the city of Ayacucho. The operation followed the killing by the army of 17 rebels on Wednesday in Putaccassa, also in Ayacucho State.

title: EQUITABLE RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Shriver Wins
description: Pam Shriver beat Ros Fairbank of South Africa tonight, 6-4, 7-6, in the second round of the $150,000 New Jersey Classic.

title: GULFSTREAM LAND & DEVELOPENT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,186,000 for the quarter and $1,479,000 for the 9 months. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $141,000 for the quarter and $117,000 for the 9 months.

title: New York Is Moving Forward on Computer Fingerprint System
description: To the Editor:

title: Exxon Deal to Hunt Oil
description: Yemen's constituent assembly today ratified an agreement with the Exxon Corporation for oil exploration in the country. Yemen has been the scene of promising oil finds.

title: COUNCIL PRESIDENT RACE TO SET A SPENDING RECORD
description: Two of the people who want to be City Council president are each spending more on the race than anyone has spent before.

title: 6 CAMPAIGNS FOR COUNCIL CHIEF TAKEN TO COURT
description: The six Democratic candidates for City Council President were confronted yesterday with legal challenges to their candidacies that could drop them from the Sept. 10 Democratic primary ballot and force them to run write-in campaigns.

title: HOW ACTORS RESHAPED 'ODD COUPLE'
description: When Lewis Stadlen showed up to audition for Neil Simon's new version of ''The Odd Couple,'' he found himself in somewhat unnerving company. Only 38 years old and possessed of a perfectly adequate head of dark hair, Mr. Stadlen ''walked in and there were 15 bald Hispanic actors in their 50's,'' he recalled. ''They all laughed at me.''

title: SCIENTIFIC LEASING INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
WEST VIRGINIA OFFICIALS ASSAILING DELAY IN ALERT
description: State and local officials reacted angrily today to Union Carbide's delay in alerting the public that a toxic gas was leaking from a chemical plant in nearby Institute.

title: JETLINER CRASHES WITH 524 ABOARD IN CENTRAL JAPAN
description: A Japan Air Lines jumbo jet carrying 524 people on a domestic flight crashed into a wooded mountain range in central Japan on Monday evening after the pilot reported that a cabin door had broken and that he had lost control.

title: AIR MIDWEST INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income.

title: EVEREST & JENNINGS INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Business and Health;   Profit Squeeze In Home Care
description: HOME health care seems to be an idea whose time has come, at least for health planners and hundreds of thousands of patients. But for many of the thousands of health agencies and companies crowding the marketplace, business has been disappointing.

title: Scovill Offering Debt Securities
description: Scovill Inc., a diversified manufacturer of housing and industrial products, is offering $200 million of debt securities in a two-part financing through Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc. as sole underwriter.

title: Jack Herbert Lockhart Dies; Ex-Scripps-Howard Official
description: Jack Herbert Lockhart, who retired in 1975 after nearly 30 years as assistant general editorial manager of Scripps-Howard Newspapers in New York, was found dead of a shotgun wound Aug. 3 at his home in Scarsdale, N.Y. He was 75 years old.

title: No Visas
description: An anti-Communist conference begins today in Geneva without two featured speakers who were left behind in Washington, the conference sponsor said, because they could not get visas on time from the Swiss Embassy.

title: Shell Canada
description: Shell Canada Ltd. said it is in the last stages of negotiations to supply New England with Alberta natural gas through conversion of an oil pipeline between Montreal and Portland, Me. A Shell Canada spokesman said the exports could start next year for up to 10 years, with a unit of the Bay State Gas Company as purchaser. Shell gave no estimate for project costs or gas prices.

title: FUDDRUCKERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: CORRECTION
description: An article yesterday about a funeral of a civil rights leader in a South African homeland misidentified an American judge who was among the mourners. He was Judge Nathaniel R. Jones from the United States Federal Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit in Cincinnati.

title: The U.N. Today: Aug. 13, 1985
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Decolonization Committee - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: OXFORD FIRST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including income of $135,000 for the quarter and a loss of $56,000 for the 6 months from discontinued operations. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $14,000 for the quarter and $137,000 for the 6 months.

title: ESSEX DEMOCRATS STAY LUCKY
description: The Essex County Clerk, a Democrat, who has drawn the top ballot position for his party in 40 of the last 41 drawings he has conducted did it again today, this time under court scrutiny.

title: 20 Hurt in Indian Violence
description: At least 20 people were injured when new violence broke out in India's western state of Gujarat today over a Government policy on minorities, the Press Trust of India reported. The news agency said 15 people were injured in street clashes in Surendranagar, five of them when the police opened fire to break up angry crowds. It said the fighting broke out between supporters and opponents of a policy reserving promotion quotas in Government jobs for underprivileged classes and castes.

title: WOODWARD A FOOTBALL NOMAD
description: Doug Woodward was back on campus this morning, eating an ice cream cone in the campus center when an old friend walked by. The professor wanted to know how he was doing, and the baby. He did not have to ask much about work.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: FOREIGN DOMESTICS One of the more important private collections of American art belongs to a titled family of German and Hungarian origins that now resides in Switzerland. Today, 113 paintings from that collection go on view in the opulent underground IBM Gallery of Arts and Science, Madison Avenue and 57th Street (407-6100).

title: Man Gives Up in Killings After Being Released
description: A 37-year-old man being sought in the killings of two elderly women surrendered to the police late tonight, the day after he was released from custody because he could not find the the victims' house, the police said. The bodies of the women were found Sunday night, several hours after he was released.

title: McCaw Unit to Buy MCI Cellular Assets
description: The MCI Communications Corporation, continuing a dispute over its holdings in the cellular and paging business, said yesterday it had agreed to sell nearly all of those assets to a subsidiary of the McCaw Communications Companies for about $120 million. That action came two weeks after MCI rescinded a $121.5 million agreement to sell the same holdings to the Mobile Communications Corporation of America.

title: CORRECTION
description: A picture caption in Business Day yesterday with an article about the biotechnology industry misidentified a worker at the Cetus Corporation. The worker, shown in a laboratory at the right, was a technician, not the chairman, Dr. Ronald Cape.

title: KIRKLAND JOINS PLEA FOR STEEL FACILITY
description: At a union rally today to press for the reopening of giant blast furnaces here, a laid-off steelworker asked Lane Kirkland what the labor federation he heads could do to help, other than ''just lend moral support.''

title: Kahane's Constituency, in Israel and the U.S.
description: To the Editor:

title: AMERICAN HEALTHCARE MANAGEMENT reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Accounts
description: * Baltimore Sun Newspapers' Evening Sun, Sun classifieds and Sun trade advertising to W. B. Doner & Co., Baltimore.

title: Florida Man, 62, Is Deported As Accomplice to the Nazis
description: Bohdan Koziy, who was ordered deported because he was a policeman working for Nazi occupation forces in World War II, has left the United States, the Justice Department said today.

title: PRAISEWORTHY EFFORT BY NBC
description: It would have been safer, if not particularly innovative, for NBC's ''Sports World'' to continue the tradition of programming that makes the three networks' sports anthology shows seem like parodies. Arm wrestling, log rolling, cliff diving, speed skating and, perhaps some day soon, chicken plucking from Havana, are events that are televised more often than anyone cares to see.

title: Chemical Spill Routs Families Near Capital
description: Six chemicals, at least one of them a highly toxic caustic agent, spilled from a tanker truck onto the Capital Beltway today, forcing the evacuation of about 70 families, officials said.

title: Gulf Canada Assets Sale
description: Gulf Canada Ltd. and Petro-Canada Inc. said Gulf, as expected, will sell its refining, distribution and marketing assets west of Quebec to Government-owned Petro-Canada, effective Sept. 30, for $446 million (United States). The companies said the transaction involves a refinery/lubricant plant at Clarkson, Ontario; an asphalt plant at Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan; Gulf's interests in a refinery at Port Moody, British Columbia, and various product pipelines and about 1,800 Gulf retail outlets.

title: Q&A
description: Q.

title: Behind the Scenes, for 35 Years, at Arena Stage
description: Zelda and Tom Fichandler can laugh about it now, 35 years after they started what has become one of the nation's leading regional theaters, but there were times when a reasonable person might have wondered if the Arena Stage was going to survive.

title: RELIANCE GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a loss of $2,007,000 from an unconsolidated subsidiary and equity of $431,000 from an investee company. c-After a loss of $1,908,000 from an unconsolidated subsidiary and equity of $729,000 from an investee company. d-Including equity of $3,968,000 in an unconsolidated company and a loss of $231,000 from an investee company. e-Including equity of $1,843,000 in an unconsolidated company and equity of $2,315,000 from an investee company.

title: PRODUCER PRICES UP 0.3% IN JULY
description: A spurt in the cost of food - the largest in a year - sent prices at the producer level up three-tenths of 1 percent in July, the Government reported today.

title: IVERSON TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net losses.

title: KING CAMP SCORES WITH YOUNGSTERS
description: Surrounded by dozens of youngsters wearing an array of T-shirts, some bearing his own No. 30, Bernard King moved smoothly from the free-throw line to the top of the circle, shooting jump shots. Each shot that went through the basket was met with a round of applause. ''Look,'' said one youth in amazement, ''he's bending his knee.''

title: CLOTHESTIME INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split effective Aug. 5 and payable to shareholders on Aug. 15.

title: FLEXWATT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
INTERNATIONAL HOLDING CAPIAL reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After an extraordinary net charge of $75,000.

title: No Baldwin
description: At the Ella Fitzgerald-Oscar Peterson concert at Wolf Trap the other night, the program noted that Baldwin was the official piano of the national park for the performing arts, but when Mr. Peterson came out to open the show, he sat down at a Bosendorfer. The instrument looked beautiful, its black lacquer gleaming in the spotlight, and it sounded beautiful, too, when Mr. Peterson played it.

title: Topics;   Feeling Driven; Night, Revisited
description: From ''Roots'' to ''Fatal Vision,'' The mini-series adaptation of lengthy books has fast become a staple of television programming, allowing millions to absorb the essence of fiction and nonfiction they might otherwise never find the time to read. But the formula has an obvious drawback for some viewers: the need to wait a day or week for the next plot development.

title: POLL BLAMES U.S. ON JAPAN TRADE
description: Most Japanese, and a majority of Americans, believe that the United States is using Japanese trade practices as a scapegoat when its real economic problems are domestic, a New York Times/CBS News/Tokyo Broadcasting System Poll shows.

title: BOB EVANS FARMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
YANKS WIN 7TH AND TRAIL BY 6
description: They have been watching the scoreboard intently the last several days, noting the progress of the Toronto Blue Jays without wanting to appear too interested in the result. But now the Yankees are winning again, and now they are talking about another surge.

title: Name Game
description: Things can get pretty confusing these days at the Minnesota Vikings' summer workouts unless everybody remembers to address everybody else by full name and, in some cases, by middle initial as well (though there are times when even that is not enough). And whatever you do, don't telephone and ask for a Mr. Jones, a Mr. Brown, a Mr. Johnson or a Mr. Smith.

title: DANCE: PICO AND REYES AT THE LATINO FESTIVAL
description: THE New York Shakespeare Festival's ''Festival Latino in New York'' offered a program of strangely flat solos by Wilson Pico and Susana Reyes on Sunday afternoon at the Circle in the Square Downtown. Set to scores that ranged from the music of the performers' native Ecuador to traditional African music, the six solos suggested that both Mr. Pico and Miss Reyes have a sensitivity to ritual that does not quite communicate itself in their dance.

title: F.B.I. SAID TO HAVE SENT MESSAGES TO SPY SUSPECT
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation sent coded messages more than a year ago to a man now described by prosecutors as a member of a Navy spy ring, proposing a meeting with him in Mexico, sources knowledgeable about the case said today.

title: Babies
description: Alice T. McGillion is not the first woman to serve as a New York City Deputy Police Commissioner. But she says she is the first New York City Deputy Police Commissioner to give birth to twins.

title: NICARAGUA REBELS REPORTED TO RAISE UP TO $25 MILLION
description: Rebels fighting the Sandinista Government of Nicaragua have received as much as $25 million in donations from private individuals in the United States and foreign sources, according to a retired general and Administration officials who work with the insurgents.

title: Fire Damages G.O.P. Center
description: An apparently accidental fire broke out on the top floor of the Republican National Committee headquarters on Capitol Hill during the weekend, the Fire Department said today.

title: LED AIR AND SPACE MUSEUM
description: S. Paul Johnston, the former director of the National Air and Space Museum of the Smithsonian Institution and former director of the Institute of Aeronautical Sciences in New York City, died Friday at Memorial Hospital in Easton, Md. He was 86 years old and lived in Easton.

title: Interruptions Hobble Nasdaq
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers said intermittent computer problems hindered the reporting of over-the-counter trades at various times yesterday.

title: ACME PRECISION PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net income including a gain of $701,700 from the sale of real estate.

SHARP FALL SHOWN BY CARBIE STOCK
description: News of Sunday's accident at the Union Carbide Corporation's Institute, W.Va., pesticide plant sent the company's stock down sharply today.

title: Ideological Tactics of the Immigration Service
description: To the Editor:

title: Trucks: Overseen or Overlooked?
description: A regional crackdown on unsafe trucks highlights a frightening trend: nearly half the highway rigs that were stopped in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut in recent months had faulty brakes, defective steering or other serious hazards. Many of the operators were driving illegally.

title: MR GASKET CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
MSI DATA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 29
description: b-Net income.

title: R's Gastronomia
description: To the Editor:

title: BRUTAL SPORTS AND BRUTAL FANS
description: NEW research prompted by increased violence among sports fans in recent years is challenging some long-held notions about the link between some highly competitive games of aggression and the observers they enthrall.

title: No Smoking
description: Many hospitals ban smoking in patients' rooms but permit it in lounges and cafeterias.

title: U.S. ASKS PRETORIA TO END STRIFE AS PROTESTERS MARCH IN WASHINGTON
description: The Reagan Administration called today on the Government of South Africa to make ''bold decisions'' to end racial violence and to give ''political rights, justice and equality'' to the country's black majority.

title: LOEWS SET TO ADD CBS STOCK
description: The Loews Corporation yesterday asked Government regulators for permission to increase its stake in CBS Inc. to as much as 15 percent from its current 9.8 percent holding.

title: Advertising;   Horner-Marsteller Tie
description: Horner Collis & Kirvan, and Marsteller, Little & Strodl have merged to form HCM/London.

title: EX-TULANE PLAYER TELLS COURT OF FIx
description: Bobby Thompson, a former Tulane University basketball player, said today that he and four teammates, including John (Hot Rod) Williams, had met several times in February to discuss shaving points in three Tulane games last season.

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. Philadelphia Phillies, at Shea Stadium, 7:35 P.M. Second of four-game series. Rick Aguilera goes for the Mets.

title: ASEA GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CASINOS IN ATLANTIC CITY SET MARK, TAKING IN $223.9 MILLION IN JULY
description: Atlantic City's 11 casinos had record gross revenues last month of $223.9 million, the Casino Control Commission reported today.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: TUESDAY, AUGUST 13, 1985
description: International

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: JOAN COLLINS, wearing a white silk dress and a big white straw hat with a brim that dipped over her face, said she loved hats and did ''a little television show on which I wear them.'' The actress, also known as Alexis on ''Dynasty,'' was introducing the Joan Collins Collection of hats at a luncheon at the Pierre yesterday. But photographers seemed to be more interested in taking pictures of her than of the models. Most of the hats were quite large, like the one she was wearing, though there were a few toques and turbans as well.

title: COMPO INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 29
description: b-Including a pretax provision of $5,031,000 relating to the consolidation of certain footwear operations. c-Net income including a pretax gain of $5,021,000 from the sale of a facility.

title: WORRIED NEW YORKERS TURN TO BOTTLE WATER
description: New Yorkers dramatically increased their purchases of bottled water in July, with some bottlers and retailers reporting that their sales have more than doubled over the corresponding period last year.

title: Police Kill Gunman After Siege in Paris
description: The police shot to death a gunman who had seriously wounded one man and held another hostage for nearly five hours today at the Paris Mosque, the police said.

title: Hutton Case Snag Possible
description: The decision on whether E. F. Hutton & Company can continue to operate in Connecticut could be delayed by the announcement yesterday that the state's banking commissioner was disqualifying himself from the case because of charges of a conflict of interest.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Saturday about pressures on American companies involved in South Africa included a quotation that incorrectly described operations of the International Business Machines Corporation there. I.B.M. sells and repairs computers in South Africa, but does not manufacture there.

title: PALM BEACH INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 29
description: b-Including tax credits of $2,763,000 for the quarter and $151,000 for the 6 months. c-Net income.

title: CROWN ROTATIONAL MOLDED PRODUCTS reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CENTRAL RESERVE LIFE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $59,213 for the quarter and the 6 months. Share earnings do not reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid July 10.

title: ONE COMPUTER MAKER IS HOT
description: By all logic, the Compaq Computer Corporation should be a long-forgotten footnote in the personal computer industry.

title: CHATHAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
COMCAST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
150,000 RIDERS AFFECTED
description: Drivers and mechanics struck four private bus lines in Queens at 12:01 A.M. today, halting service to more than 150,000 daily riders on express and local buses in Queens and the Bronx, officials said.

title: No Lack of Irish
description: The Speaker of the House of Representatives, Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., has made no secret of his desire to close out a long career of public service as Ambassador to Ireland, but his chances seemed to have slipped yesterday.

title: WORKERS DENY PRESSURE TO GIVE 1% TO G.O.P.
description: Several employees of the Town of Hempstead testified today that as loyal Republicans they had contributed to the party voluntarily, and that they had never been forced to do so to keep their jobs or win promotions or raises.

title: EXPERT WARNS OF NEED TO TEACH POOR CHILDREN
description: ECONOMIC and social disaster may be in store for this country if schools and colleges fail to educate ''hard to teach'' students, a leading expert in demographics has warned.

title: Winding Up With a Record
description: Dwight Gooden extended his record to 18-3 the other day, which means that if his year's work were completed right now, he would have the seventh-highest single-season winning percentage (.857) in modern major league history among all pitchers with at least 20 decisions. The six who were better: Ron Guidry of the 1978 Yankees (.893), Lefty Grove of the 1931 Philadelphia Athletics (.886), Preacher Roe of the 1951 Brooklyn Dodgers (.880), Joe Wood of the 1912 Boston Red Sox (.872) and both Whitey Ford of the 1961 Yankees and Wild Bill Donovan of the 1907 Detroit Tigers (each at .862).

title: WELDON KEES LETTERS SKETCH 40'S INTELLECTUALS
description: A collection of letters written by Weldon Kees - many of them filled with extraordinary portraits of the New York intellectuals of the 1940's -is being prepared for publication late this year. Kees, a poet, critic, short-story writer, painter and musician, was widely acclaimed in the 40's and 50's and then all but forgotten for 20 years after he disappeared -presumably a suicide - in 1955.

title: HUGE FARM CROPS ARE PREDICTED: PRESSURE IS SEEN FOR PRICE SUPPORTS
description: The Government projected today that American farmers will harvest huge corn and soybean crops this year, prompting fears of further distress for hard-pressed farm communities and putting additional pressure on Congress for support payments.

title: Capital Cities Debt Offering
description: Capital Cities Communications Inc. is offering $300 million of 11 5/8 percent, 30-year sinking fund debentures at a price of 99.60 to yield 11.673 percent, through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: The Solution
description: Bob Dernier explains what he and his Chicago Cub teammates must do to get back into the race: ''We have to finish with a Detroit start.''

title: DANIEL INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Net loss

title: MADISON GAS & ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
RACING'S CONFUSED CONSCIENCE
description: The Sunday after the Alabama Stakes at Saratoga is traditionally a day to get up in time to make the annual 10 A.M. Jockey Club Round Table on Matters Pertaining to Racing. The idea is that all of the sport's movers and shakers are in town on the weekend between the yearling sales and the Travers Stakes, and a convocation to address the sport's most pressing issues seems a worthy idea.

title: SLOAN-KETTERING GETS $36.2 MILLION GIFT
description: The Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center has received a $36.2 million gift from Laurance S. Rockefeller and plans to build a new research center that will be partly financed by the donation.

title: MUSIC: ANTIQUE ORGAN
description: ONE of the oldest nearly intact three-manual organs from America's mid-19th century has been leading a relatively quiet life since moving to the Victorian village of Round Lake, N.Y., 97 years ago. Richard Ferris built the instrument in 1847 for Calvary Episcopal Church in New York's Lower East Side, and Round Lake, largely a Methodist camp meeting site in those days, acquired it 40 years later.

title: OAK INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $6,759,000 for the quarter and $12,216,000 for the 6 months.

title: THE TALK OF PARIS
description: Americans here talk about restaurant reservations, the gently slipping dollar and how brave they are to travel in the age of hijackings. Parisians, being Parisians, talk about what concerns Paris: a new chapter in the Dreyfus affair, a scooter taxi service, and the huge French Disneyland scheduled to be built in the mustard fields 15 miles east of the city.

title: WAL-MART STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
Flaw Is Confirmed In Shuttle Sensors
description: Tests have confirmed that the space shuttle Challenger's premature engine shutdown during the climb to orbit July 29 was caused by two faulty heat sensors in a high-power fuel pump, space agency officials said today.

title: Required Reading;   Fairness Means . . .
description: Excerpts from remarks by Senator Carl Levin, Democrat of Michigan, before the Fairness Commission of the Democratic National Committee, Lansing, Mich., Aug. 10:

title: Spores in Space May Have Spread Life in Universe
description: SCIENTISTS say new experiments suggest the possibility that hard, dry bacteria floating in space might be able to spread and survive in the far reaches of the universe.

title: Tudor Wins Again for Cards
description: John Tudor scattered five hits over eight innings tonight for his 14th victory in his last 15 starts as the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Pittsburgh Pirates, 8-1.

title: 3,088-Page Revision Of City's Laws Signed
description: Governor Cuomo has signed what is apparently the most voluminous bill ever passed by the New York Legislature - a revision of New York City's administrative code that runs 3,088 pages and weighs 32 pounds.

title: Californian Wins 10th Race Stage
description: Jeff Pierce of San Diego led a breakaway group of six up 11,316-foot Fremont Pass and sailed into this Rocky Mountain ski resort today with a 100-meter lead over the pack to win the 10th stage of the Coors International Bicycle Classic.

title: Xiao Hua of China, 69; Long Army Commissar
description: Xiao Hua, former chief political commissar of the Chinese armed forces, died here today, the New China News Agency announced. He was 69 years old.

title: ORBANCO FINANCIAL SERVICES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-After a provision of $23 million for estimated loss on the liquidation of Orbanco. c-After a $4.9 million increase in the loan loss reserve provision.

title: Argentina Debt Accord
description: The Government of Argentina will sign agreements to restructure much of its foreign debt on Aug. 27 in New York, Citibank announced yesterday.

title: STUDENT DEMONSTRATORS WHIPPED
description: The police shot a 12-year-old girl to death in a black township near Pretoria on Sunday night, and today officers used whips and tear gas to break up a demonstration by black and white university students in Johannesburg.

title: RECOTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
BELL INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
WICHITA INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Monsanto Stake
description: The Monsanto Company said it had bought 25.3 million of the common stock of G. D. Searle & Company in a previously announced $65-a-share tender offer, scheduled to expire Aug. 16. The purchase, representing 60 percent of Searle's outstanding shares, was made by a Monsanto subsidiary, 1985 Holdings Company.

title: Sri Lanka Rejects Demands by Rebels
description: A Sri Lanka Government delegation today rejected demands by Tamil rebels, leading to the cancellation of the afternoon talks on the island's ethnic dispute, a Tamil spokesman said.

title: TECHNICAL TAPE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: b-Includes a reduction in deferred income taxes of $557,000 representing forgiveness of income taxes by the 1984 Tax Reform Act on qualified earnings of a domestic international sales corporation.

title: NORTH EUROPEAN OIL ROYALTY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to July 31

COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Avalon Corp., a former real estate concern that is redeploying its assets in the energy business, and MSR Exploration Ltd. said they have reached agreement for Avalon to acquire a controlling interest in MSR Exploration.

title: Seymour Schneidman; Led Accounting Firm
description: Seymour Schneidman, president of the New York City accounting firm that bore his name, died Sunday of a heart ailment at the New York University Medical Center. He was 68 years old and lived in Greenwich, Conn., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: PACKAGING SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Share earnings reflect a 10 percent stock dividend issued in May.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Arthur Young & Co. has named William L. Gladstone chairman, succeeding William S. Kanaga, who will remain with the company in an advisory role.

title: PRUDENTIAL-BACHE HAS A REBOUND IN EARNINGS
description: Prudential-Bache Securities Inc. said yesterday that its recovery from last year's loss picked up momentum in the second quarter. The firm said net income in the latest period amounted to $17.7 million before taxes, compared to a $48.4 million loss a year earlier.

title: CONCERT: MCGARRIGLES
description: ON a good night, Kate and Anna McGarrigle, the Montreal-based duo of sisters who sing and write contemporary folk songs, make music that magically connects more than a century's worth of diverse folk and pop idioms. Underscored by shifting combinations of piano, guitar, accordion, banjo and violin, the sisters' wryly sweet harmonies and their playful stage manner evoke a rustic North American musicale with a strong French-Canadian influence.

title: Schwarzenegger Plans To Wed TV Reporter
description: Maria Owings Shriver, a reporter for CBS Morning News, and Arnold Schwarzenegger, the star of ''Pumping Iron,' ''Conan the Barbarian'' and ''The Terminator,'' plan to be married.

title: $222 Million Offering By Southern Minnesota
description: The Southern Minnesota Municipal Power Agency is offering $222 million of electric revenue bonds that were tentatively priced yesterday with a maximum yield of 9.65 percent for 9 1/2 percent bonds due in 2017 through underwriters led by Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc.

title: QUAREX INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 28
Thorn EMI Unit In Market Project
description: Thorn EMI P.L.C. said its subsidiary Software Science is adapting a United States-designed computer system to assist market-makers when the London Stock Exchange is deregulated next year.

title: Port Authority Names Maritime Unit Director
description: James J. Kirk, a 33-year employee of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, has been named director of the agency's port department.

title: Rhode Island Marks V-J Day
description: A commemorative ceremony for veterans and an anti-nuclear protest today marked the 40th anniversary of V-J Day in Rhode Island, the only state that still observes Japan's surrender in World War II as an official holiday.

title: Advertising;   Fearon's Departure Causes Name Change
description: Fearon O'Leary Kaprielian has changed its name again. The agency started out as Fearon O'Leary Associates in 1980 before Walter Kaprielian joined it as creative director in 1983.

title: CHESS: KASPAROV IS AN EASY WINNER IN TRAINING-SESSION MATCHES
description: Gary Kasparov, the 22-year-old Soviet challenger for the world championship, could not have had more confidence-breeding practice for his upcoming match with Anatoly Karpov than his two training matches. After he defeated the West German grandmaster Robert Huebner in Hamburg by 4 1/2-1 1/2, Kasparov won from the Swedish grandmaster Ulf Andersson in Belgrade by 4-2.

title: Bourque Rewarded
description: Ray Bourque, a first-team all-star in four of his six seasons, has signed a six-year contract with the Boston Bruins that reportedly makes him the highest paid defenseman in the National Hockey League. ''Without a top defenseman around which your team can operate, your chances of doing much in the National Hockey League are very slim,'' the Boston general manager, Harry Sinden, said yesterday.

title: JUDGE DISMISSES COMPLAINT IN BOSTON GLOBE LIBEL CASE
description: A judge today dismissed all claims against The Boston Globe and one of its reporters in a libel suit brought by a former candidate for governor.

title: POPE MAKES SHARP COMMENTS ON AFRICA
description: Pope John Paul II issued a stinging statement here today on the problems of Africa that included sharp criticism of wealthy nations and of African governments.

description: b-Net income.

title: 'WEST 57TH,' ON CBS: MAGAZINE HAS ITS DEBUT
description: ''WEST 57TH,'' CBS News' new magazine show, isn't really television, and it certainly isn't journalism; it's video, and it's a mess. Nothing works well except the synthesizer music. It's as if news and entertainment fell into combat and neither side won. It will be seen on Channel 2 at 10 o'clock tonight.

title: TIGHT MARKET THREATENS UPSTATE GRAPE GROWERS
description: New York's grape farmers, already hurt by prices that have fallen steadily since 1980, face disastrous market conditions this fall, according to industry experts.

title: Careers;   Liberal Arts Engineers
description: FOR years, engineers have been studying for master of business administration degrees, in the hope they can rise higher in management with the engineering and business combination.

description: Share earnings have been restated to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in August 1984.

title: Bridge: Spingold Knockout Rounds End Las Vegas Competition
description: The biggest bridge tournament ever played anywhere ended Sunday night for all but an important handful of players: They were members of the 4 surviving teams in the prestigious Spingold Knockout Team Championship, which began last Wednesday with 146 teams.

title: AIRLINE DISASTERS: HISTORY'S WORST
description: Airliner Disasters: History's Worst xhrrHere is a list of some of the worst international and domestic air disasters:
